cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles WNW of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to turn north‐northwest and track parallel to or just inland of the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the south-east coast of Florida (around South Florida)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet under Tropical Storm Watch (far south of Baltimore, MD)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical Storm Warnings posted only for the Bahamas and Hispaniola—none yet for U.S. Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, Florida peninsula, southeast U.S. coast, and extending northward to the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤39-mph) tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (only 4 % chance), but gusty 25-35 mph winds are possible as the system passes.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor water-level rises (1–2 ft) are possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay if the center tracks inland of the bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 2–4 inches of rain with localized higher totals, which could trigger urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes or waterspouts cannot be ruled out in outer rain-bands; heavy rain could reduce visibility and hamper cargo handling.
